page.title: 15Wolseley Bridge.
page.content: This area central to our block has a few houses. There is an inn, now known as the Wolseley Arms, which stands at the junction of the A513 and the A51. This inn is adjacent to the River Trent. Also there is a cafe and a craft centre. In another building, a 17th Century threshing barn, is a display of a local artist's work. The barn was removed from its original location at Colton near Rugeley, where it prevented new farm buildings being erected, to the present site in 1984. It is one of the oldest farm buildings in Staffordshire and it is a pleasure to see that it has been saved for posterity. Wolseley Hall was demolished during the 1960's which had been the seat of the Wolseley's for many generations. The estate is still in the ownership of Sir Charles Wolseley. The Dowager Lady Wolseley lives locally.
